New Records: Will Smith hit a tying, two-run homer and the Los Angeles Dodgers scored three more runs in the seventh to beat the San Diego Padres 7-2, clinching the NL West title.
Key Match Events: Will Smith hit a 426-foot blast to center, flipping his bat while tying the game at 2-2.
Pinch-hitter Kiké Hernández singled and took second when Andy Pages reached on catcher’s interference by Kyle Higashioka.
Shohei Ohtani singled and Hernández scored and Ohtani was safe at second on Fernando Tatis Jr.'s throwing error.
Pages and Ohtani scored on Mookie Betts’ single, making it 5-2.
Pages added a two-run, two-strike, two-out homer in the eighth.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams had already clinched postseason berths.
A sellout crowd of 52,433, including retired Dodgers star Manny Ramirez, packed Dodger Stadium for the finale of the crucial series between the top teams in the NL West.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said, “I couldn’t be more proud of these guys. They fought and fought and fought and overcame adversity.”
Roberts added, “Doing it in front of the home fans, beating those guys, winning a series, it’s pretty sweet.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers (95-64) had not clinched at home since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season, when cardboard cutouts replaced fans.
The last time fans were on hand for a clincher at home was 2018.
Freddie Freeman left the game after awkwardly colliding with Luis Arráez and the first base bag trying to avoid being tagged for the second out of the inning.
Others: The Dodgers placed RHP Brusdar Graterol on IL with right shoulder inflammation.
SS Miguel Rojas (left groin tightness) had an MRI that showed a torn adductor.
LHP Anthony Banda was activated off IL.
Placed RHP Brent Honeywell Jr. on IL with a cracked right middle fingernail.
